subject: Re: [junit] Why no errors in JUnit 4?
msgSnippet: That s interesting.  I myself never really found it all that useful, nor that much of a distraction.  What did you use it for?  Did you fix errors before
messageBody:
That's interesting. I myself never really found it all that useful, nor
that much of a distraction. What did you use it for? Did you fix
errors before failures, or vice versa? Did you find one harder to fix
than the other?

David Saff

Elliotte Harold wrote:

> JUnit 4 seems to have removed the distinction between failures and
> errors. What's the thinking behind this? I always found it to be a
> useful distinction myself.
>
> --
